text: hi I'm David Pogue and do you know what
I love about this job is a tech critic
it's getting a front-row seat to
innovation fresh thinking new directions
like last year Apple came up with this a
touchscreen tablet called the ipad write
a whole new category and now there's
this the motorola xoom obviously you can
see it goes in a completely new
direction I mean it's it's not silver on
the back it runs a totally different
operating system too it runs Android
3-pointer from google instead of
unlocking the screen like fat you unlock
it like that see totally different and
look at this the ipad has 11 screens
where you can park the icons for your
apps on android 3.0 there's five screens
five instead of 11 see different the
ipad has this ebook reading program look
at this cool page-turning animation
isn't that neat well in android 3.0
google added the e-book reader too but
look at the difference here the page
turns bulge from the middle instead of
from the corner now that's refreshing
now you might think that the new android
email program has been redesigned to
look exactly like the iPads email
program but look more closely the
highlighting color on android is light
blue and on the ipad it's dark blue
totally different design approach ok i'm
being a little snark astok a little
there really are some fresh new ideas in
android 3.0 for example i like how you
switch among recently open eps this new
way to copy and paste and how you can
drag emails into folders and the zoom
does have some hardware that the

question is is that worth eight hundred

than the ipad and also remember there

although that'll change
look I kid because i love the zoom is
